data.title: Thomas Fitch IV (1700-1774)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Thomas Fitch IV born 1700 Hartford, Connecticut died 1774 Hartford, Connecticut including ancestors + descendants + 1 photos + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Govenor Thomas Fitch IV

Born 6 Jun 1700 in Hartford, Connecticut

Ancestors

Son of Thomas Fitch III and Elizabeth (Lane) Fitch

Husband of Hannah (Hall) Fitch — married 4 Sep 1724 [location unknown]

Descendants

Died 18 Jul 1774 at age 74 in Hartford, Connecticut

Profile last modified 11 Jul 2022 | Created 27 Feb 2014

This page has been accessed 3,561 times.

Biography

Thomas Fitch IV is Notable.

THE HON'BLE THOMAS FITCH Esqr Gov'r of the Colony of CONNECTICUT:

Eminent, and distinguished among mortals, For great abilities, large aquirements and a virtuous character; a clear, strong, sedate mind ; an accurate, extensive acquaintance with Law and civil Government; a happy Talent of presiding ; close application, and strict fidelity in the the discharge of important Trusts ; no less than, for his employments, by the voice of the people, in the chief offices of State, and at the HEAD of the COLONY. Having served his generation by the Will of God fell asleep July 18th, Ann Domini, 1774. in the 75th Year of his age.

Governor Thos Fitch was son of Thomas. He married Srp 4, 1724, Hannah Hall of New Haven the eldest daug of Richard and Hannah (Miles) Hall]. The Hon'ble Thomas was the Governor's assistant 1734-5 and from 1740 to 1754 when he was elected Governor, May, the same year and remained as such to May 1763 when he came back to Norwalk lived, and probably died, at what is now known as the old Fitch place, on East ave. a little south of opposite the East entrance to the road leading to Oyster Shell point. A large elm tree is seen in front of the home as a landmark undisturbed.

Thomas Fitch was born in 1700 in Norwalk, CT to Thomas Fitch III and his 1st wife Sarah. [1]

Thomas married 1st Sarah. [1]

Thomas married 2nd Hannah Sep 4 1724. She was the eldest daughter of Richard and Hannah (Miles) Hall of New Haven. She died Aug 1779, age 78.[1]

He was Governor of Connecicut 1754-1766. Large article exists in Fitch Family, also includes part of article from "The Fitch Papers" published by CT Historical Society [1]

The list of children is as follows: [1]

Col Thomas V, b Aug 12 1725, d Jan 16 1795, res Norwalk, CT

Col Jonathan, b Apr 12 1727, d Sep 12 1793, res New Haven, CT

Ebenezer, b Feb 25 1729, m Lydia Mills, d Feb 23 1762, res Wilton, CT

Hannah, b Apr 10 1731, d Aug 24 1744

Mary, b Sep 20 1733, mar _____ Thatcher

Timothy, b 1735, mar Esther Platt, d Sep 18 1802, res Norwalk, CT

Hon. Hezekiah, mar Sep 21 1767 Jerusha Burr, res Salisbury, CT

Elizabeth, b 1739, mar Andrew Rowland

Esther, unmarried, d Mar 12 1771, in 30th year

Giles, d Apr 1747, in 2d year

He died Jul 18 1774, age 74, in Hartford, CT. Table Monument states he was in the 78th year of his age. [1]

His will is dated 5 March 1774 and proved on 18 August 1774 in Fairfield.[2]

His inventory was began in the month of November 1774 and was completed in the monthe of February 1781.[3]

In 1787, an estate distribution was set out to Hannah, the widow, Mary, Elizabeth, Thomas, Jonathan, heirs of Ebenezer, decd (Jabez, Ebenezer, Giles, and Hannah). Timothy, and Hezekiah.[4]

Sources

↑ 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3 1.4 1.5 History of the Fitch family, A. D. 1400-1930; a record ... v.1. Fitch, Roscoe Conkling, 1903- pg 116-117, 121-135

↑ “Probate Records, v. 17-18, 1767-1776”, database with images, FamilySearch (https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/3:1:3QSQ-G92K-Y5SD : 25 June 2022), FHL microfilm 007627294, image 277-278, Fairfield, Fairfield, Connecticut, Vol 17, 1767-1776, Page 515-517.

↑ “Probate Records, v. 19-20, 1775-1783”, database with images, FamilySearch (https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/3:1:3QSQ-G92K-T2PR : 6 July 2022), FHL microfilm 007627295, image 416-423, Fairfield, Fairfield, Connecticut, Vol 20, 1778-1781, Pages 244-262.

↑ “Probate Records, v. 21-23, 1781-1847”, database with images, FamilySearch (https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/3:1:3QSQ-G92K-Y2QC : 10 July 2022), FHL microfilm 007627288, image 350-359, Fairfield, Fairfield, Connecticut, Vol 23, 1785-1788, Pages 222-240.

Dexter, Franklin Bowditch. Biographical Sketches of the Graduates of Yale College (Holt, 1885) Vol.1, Page 247, Vol. 1, Page 562

Van Hoosear, David Hermon. A Complete Copy of the Inscriptions Found on the Monuments, Headstones, &c., in the Oldest Cemetery in Norwalk, Conn. (The Standard Association, Bridgeport, Conn., 1895) Page XXIV

Wikipedia: Thomas_Fitch_(governor)

Find A Grave: Memorial #5013 Table monument.

Weed, Samuel Richards. Norwalk After Two Hundred & Fifty Years (C.A. Freeman, South Norwalk, Conn, 1901) Page 280
